title: .NET With Angular
description:
**Job Description**
**Job Title: Senior Full Stack Developer (AngularJS / ASP.NET Core / MongoDB)**
**Location:** 
 Pune
   

  

**Experience:** 
 9–12 Years
   

  

**Employment Type:** 
 Full\\-Time
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain scalable full stack applications using AngularJS (front\\-end) and ASP.NET Core (back\\-end).
* Build RESTful APIs, microservices, and cloud\\-native components.
* Develop front\\-end UI components using HTML, CSS, and responsive design principles.
* Work extensively with MongoDB, including schema design, indexing, and query optimization.
* Deploy, manage, and optimize applications on Azure Cloud and Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
* Ensure high performance, security, and scalability across the application stack.
* Collaborate closely with product owners, architects, QA, and DevOps teams.
* Participate in code reviews, provide technical guidance, and mentor junior developers.
* Work within Agile/Scrum methodologies and contribute to sprint planning and estimations.


**Required Skills \\& Experience**
* 9 to 12 years of experience in full stack web application development.
* Strong proficiency in AngularJS (1\\.x) and modern JavaScript concepts.
* Solid hands\\-on experience in ASP.NET Core, C\\#, and building backend APIs.
* Strong experience with MongoDB, including aggregation pipelines and performance tuning.
* Good understanding of Azure Cloud services (App Services, Functions, Storage, CI/CD).
* Hands\\-on exposure to Google Cloud Platform (Cloud Run, GCE, Pub/Sub, Firestore experience is a plus).
* Strong front\\-end fundamentals: HTML5, CSS3, Bootstrap, Responsive UI.
* Experience working with microservices, containerization (Docker), and CI/CD pipelines.
* Strong debugging, troubleshooting, and problem\\-solving skills.
* Excellent communication and stakeholder management abilities.

title: System Engineer I - Desktop Support
description:
**Scope**
* The Desktop Support Engineer provides frontline technical support to end users across the organization, ensuring reliable operation of desktop systems, laptops, peripherals, and collaboration tools. This role is responsible for diagnosing and resolving hardware, software, and connectivity issues while delivering excellent customer service and adhering to ITG standards, security requirements, and service\\-level expectations.\\`


**Our Current Technical Environment**
* Hardware/Software: HP, Dell, Lenovo, Apple. Windows 11, office 365, Outlook, teams
* Applications: Oracle, perforce, JDK, QuickBooks, JIRA, Workday
* Cloud Architecture: MS Azure, Azure AD, Intune, Defender, Entra, Exchange 365, Vmware
* Network/Others: Palo Alto, Ruckus, Cisco, Schneider


**What You’ll Do**
* Provide end to end IT support for all India office users physically and remotely.
* Develops and maintains entire IT Infrastructure.
* Work on various responsibilities other than desktop support like networking, VMware, Azure, Intune, office 365, Server hardware


**What We Are Looking For**
* 1 to 3 years of experience in desktop/IT support including hardware expertise.
* Experience in Provide Tier 1 and Tier 2 technical support for desktops, laptops, mobile devices, printers, and peripherals
* Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, operating system, and network connectivity issues (Windows and/or macOS)
* Install, configure, image, and deploy desktops, laptops, and approved software applications
* Manage user accounts, permissions, and access using Active Directory, Microsoft Entra ID (Azure AD), Intune and related tools
* Support Microsoft 365 applications, including Outlook, Teams, OneDrive, and SharePoint
* Respond to service desk tickets, prioritize workload, and meet established SLAs
* Escalate complex issues to appropriate IT teams while maintaining ownership and follow\\-up
* Perform system updates, patches, and routine maintenance in accordance with ITG policies
* Support onboarding and offboarding activities, including equipment provisioning and access setup
* Document incidents, resolutions, procedures, and asset information in the IT service management system
* Assist with IT projects, upgrades, and office move as needed
* Ensure compliance with cybersecurity, data protection, and acceptable use policies
* Additional knowledge on schneider access expert will be beneficial.


**Our Values**
 If you want to know the heart of a company, take a look at their values. Ours unite us. They are what drive our success – and the success of our customers. Does your heart beat like ours? Find out here: Core Values
   

  

 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

title: Staff Software Engineer
description:
Uniphore is one of the largest B2B AI\\-native companies—decades\\-proven, built\\-for\\-scale and designed for the enterprise. The company drives business outcomes, across multiple industry verticals, and enables the largest global deployments.
   

  

 Uniphore infuses AI into every part of the enterprise that impacts the customer. We deliver the only multimodal architecture centered on customers that combines Generative AI, Knowledge AI, Emotion AI, workflow automation and a co\\-pilot to guide you. We understand better than anyone how to capture voice, video and text and how to analyze all types of data.
   

  

 As AI becomes more powerful, every part of the enterprise that impacts the customer will be disrupted. We believe the future will run on the connective tissue between people, machines and data: all in the service of creating the most human processes and experiences for customers and employees.
   

  

**Job Description**
 As a Staff Software Engineer within Product Engineering, you will act as a senior technical contributor within a frontend domain, owning the design and delivery of complex UI features and subsystems. You will collaborate closely with product management, design, backend, platform, and security teams to build reliable, performant, and secure user experiences that meet product requirements.
   

  

 In this role, you remain strongly hands\\-on while influencing technical decisions within your team or product area, mentoring engineers, and driving best practices in frontend development. You are expected to take ownership of non\\-trivial technical problems, improve system quality, and ensure frontend solutions scale within your domain.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Design and implement front\\-end solutions for complex features and subsystems within a product area.
* Own and evolve key UI components or modules, ensuring scalability and maintainability.
* Collaborate with product, design, backend, and platform teams to deliver well\\-integrated frontend functionality.
* Participate actively in technical design and code reviews, focusing on code quality, performance, accessibility, and security.
* Contribute hands\\-on to feature development, refactoring efforts, and performance improvements.
* Apply and reinforce testing practices, secure coding standards, and accessibility guidelines.
* Identify and resolve frontend quality issues and security vulnerabilities within owned areas.
* Mentor junior and mid\\-level engineers through code reviews and technical guidance.
* Ensure frontend deliverables meet reliability, usability, and release\\-quality expectations.
* Support sprint execution and release activities for frontend initiatives.


**Requirements**
* 7–10 years of professional software engineering experience with a strong focus on frontend development.
* Proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript.
* Experience building applications using React, Vue.js, or Angular.
* Solid understanding of browser fundamentals, rendering behavior, and client\\-side security.
* Experience with component\\-based architectures and state management libraries.
* Hands\\-on experience integrating with REST APIs and real\\-time data sources.
* Practical experience with unit, integration, and end\\-to\\-end testing.
* Familiarity with addressing dependency upgrades, security issues, and production defects.
* Strong collaboration skills and ability to work effectively with cross\\-functional partners.
* Good problem\\-solving skills and ability to make sound technical trade\\-offs.


 Good to Have
   

  

* Experience owning end\\-to\\-end frontend delivery for medium\\-to\\-large features.
* Exposure to build tooling, bundlers, and performance optimization techniques.
* Experience contributing to shared UI components or internal libraries.
* Familiarity with front\\-end monitoring and error tracking tools.
* Exposure to accessibility and internationalization requirements.
* Experience supporting production releases and post\\-release issue resolution.
* Participation in internal technical discussions or design reviews.
* Hands\\-on experience with AI\\-first development environments (e.g., Claude Code, Cursor) and a proven ability to leverage LLMs for rapid prototyping, debugging, and boilerplate reduction while maintaining deep technical oversight.


**Location preference:**
 India \\- Bangalore
   

  

 Uniphore is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversity in the workplace. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, and other protected characteristics.
   

  

 For more information on how Uniphore uses AI to unify—and humanize—every enterprise experience, please visit www.uniphore.com.
